Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Therapeutic Plasma Exchange in Cardiac Surgery Patients with Heparin-Induced Thrombocytopenia

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were randomised to receive TPE with heparin re-exposure or standard care.

Participants.evidence: Participants included patients diagnosed with HIT requiring cardiac surgery with CPB.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomised to receive TPE with heparin re-exposure or standard care.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the impact of intraoperative therapeutic plasma exchange (TPE) on thromboembolic events, bleeding, and mortality in HIT patients undergoing CPB.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of HIT-related thromboembolic events within 7 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 24 patients were randomised, with 12 in each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Thromboembolic events occurred in 3 patients, with 2 possibly HIT-related. The effect size for thromboembolic events was not statistically significant.

Harms.evidence: Three patients (12.5%) died within 30 days post-surgery, none of which were HIT-related.
